txt.en: 'Please, [placeholder], let yourself be seen wiping these hateful scrawls off the walls and doors of Dale.'

'The discontent of Dale-folk over the new-arrived refugees has not abated, [placeholder]. Now angry scrawls have begun appearing on walls and doors around Dale: a bell with arrows pointing away. The meaning is clear enough to us.\n\n'Will you help us wipe these defacements from Dale? Seeing a formidable and respected foreigner such as yourself doing so will strike respect - or shame - into our people's hearts.'
You should find angry scrawls on walls and doors throughout Dale and remove them.
You should return to Gaumar, who stands within the Great-keep in Dale.
TBD would you help us out in some other ways, as well?
Those discontented with the newly-arrived refugees have been leaving angry scrawls throughout Dale.
'Those angry scrawls are gone? Thank you, [placeholder].'
